intro: Tinospora fragosa subsp. kaokoensis, commonly known as the Kaoko tinospora, is a climbing shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Menispermaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces yellowish berries that are edible but not widely consumed by humans. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of the region's biodiversity.
